subsection_content:
Hip joint bursitis will increase mucus secretion, leading to swelling and severe pain in the hip joint. The pain increases when the patient walks or exercises a lot and is relieved when stopping activity and resting. (2)
In addition, the disease can cause some symptoms such as:
Stiffness.; Limited ability to walk and exercise; The damaged area is bruised or red; There is a cracking sound when walking; Dryness or joint effusion.
Systemic symptoms include:
Often mild fever in the evening; Fatigue, weakness; Anorexia.
